issue.title: Align Date implementation between Java and C++
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-420](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-420). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently C++ treats it as an int32 (no interpretation specified) and Java as an int64 with (rounded) milliseconds since 1970 but only the date (year, month, day) part actually being defined.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-420?focusedCommentId=15745676) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
This is the implementation part of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-413 as I don't want to have this differing implementation between Java and C++ in the 0.2 release.
